thread.title: Anna Chennault Bridged East and West but Wasn’t Always Appreciated

author: James R. Hagerty
title: Anna Chennault Bridged East and West but Wasn’t Always Appreciated
text:
Anna Chan and Gen. Claire Chennault were an unlikely match. When they met during World War II, she was a fledgling Chinese journalist. He was 30 years older and the commander of the U.S. 14th Air Force helping Chinese troops fight Japanese invaders.
She was single. He was married, with eight children back home in the U.S.
She noticed his “strong-jawed...
